intro: Silene anisoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene anisoloba is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
